STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 8, 2025
Lauren Skinner
WOLVERINE CENTER
2629 LENOX ST,
DETROIT, MI, 48215-2667
Re: License #: CI820201513
SI #: 2025SIC0000350
Dear Lauren Skinner:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***This report contains quoted profanity***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000350
Special Investigation Intake Date: January 31, 2025
License #: CI820201513
Licensee Group Organization: Wolverine Human Services
Licensee Designee: Judith Fischer
Chief Administrator: Lauren Skinner
Agency Name: WOLVERINE CENTER
Agency Address: 2629 LENOX ST
DETROIT, MI 48215-2667
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 07/30/2025
Capacity: 23
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Contact Method Contact Purpose
Date
03/13/2025 Phone Interview
03/13/2025 Face to Face Interview
03/13/2025 Phone Other
02/28/2025 Video Conference MIC Pre-Disposition Meeting
02/12/2025 Onsite Inspection Other
02/12/2025 Face to Face Interview
02/06/2025 Phone Other
02/03/2025 Onsite Inspection Interview
02/03/2025 Email Other
01/31/2025 Phone Interview
01/31/2025 Documentation Special Investigation Initiation
III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation #1:
On 12/22/24, Staff 1 came up behind a youth and hit the youth in
the head with their hand, causing the youth's head to jolt to the
side.
Allegation #2:
Staff 6 punched youth on the left side of his chest on unknown
date and time. No injuries were sustained, but youth reports he
was sore after the incident.
Investigation Interviews
Allegation #1
On 01/31/2025 a telephone call was held with Complainant.
Clarification regarding allegations was provided. No additional
information or concerns were noted.
On 01/31/2025 a telephone call was held with DHHS Specialist 3.
Interview with Youth A was coordinated. Due to distance, it was
noted that I would participate via telephone.
On 01/31/2025 an in-person interview of Youth A was completed
by DHHS Specialist 3 at Eagle Village. I participated via
telephone. Youth A confirmed that he recalled Staff 1 and stated
she was one of the best staff at Wolverine. He stated she
protected him and would always redirect other youth if they were
bothering him. He described her as “very kind”. Youth A had no
concerns regarding Staff 1. He denied Staff 1 ever did anything to
harm him. He denied she ever hit or slapped him and specifically
denied Staff 1 had ever hit him or slapped him in the head. He
stated Staff 1 would never do something like that. He also denied
that she would even do something like that in a playful or joking
manner.
On 1/31/2025 an email was sent to the FCW of Youth A. A
request was made to respond with any concerns relative to the
youth’s placement at Wolverine. On 02/03/2025 a response email
2

was received from FCW. She provided some case history for
Youth A and denied that she had any concerns regarding his
placement at Wolverine.
The following interviews occurred at Wolverine on 02/03/2025
with myself and DHHS Specialist 1, unless otherwise noted.
An interview was completed with the Chief Administrator. She
was advised of the allegations and the video footage that had
been previously provided was reviewed with her. She confirmed
that she did not notice the actions of Staff 1 when she previously
watched the video. Chief Administrator confirmed that there were
no incident reports relative to Staff 1 hitting Youth A in the head,
as no one saw it occur and it was not prominently visible on the
video. On 2/12/2025 DHHS Specialist 3 and I met with Chief
Administrator. She confirmed that there were no incident reports
involving Youth A. She also confirmed that there is no disciplinary
actions in the file for Staff 1.
An interview was held with Staff 1. She was advised of the
allegations and was allowed to review the video footage. Staff 1
confirmed that was her on the video, but denied that she was
attempting to cause any harm to Youth A. She stated that she
pushed him trying to get him to go to his room so she could assist
staff with the other pertinent situation. She stated she told him to
“get his ass out the way” and did not mean any harm. She denied
that Youth A complained of any pain and pointed out that his head
did not hit the wall as a result of the push by her.
An interview was completed with Youth C. He reported that he
likes Staff 1 and gets along well with her. He stated he does not
know of any youth that does not like her. He described her as “a
chill staff” and stated she doesn’t get rough or mad. He denied
ever seeing Staff 1 hit, push or kick any youth at Wolverine.
An interview was completed with Youth D. He stated he has a
great relationship with Staff 1 and she is like a grandmother to all
the youth. He denied seeing her be rough with youth or hit any
youth. He stated she is well liked and he does not know of any
youth or staff that do not like her.
On 02/12/2025 an interview of Staff 2 was completed at
Wolverine. He confirmed that he was familiar with Staff 1 and
reported that he has never seen her hit a youth or do anything like
that. He reported having no concerns with Staff 1 and denied that
any youth has expressed concern to him regarding Staff 1. He
3

further indicated that “everyone loves” Staff 1 and she was one of
the staff that could handle Youth A.
On 02/12/2025 an interview was held with Staff 3. She confirmed
that she worked with Staff 1 often and described her as a “great”
staff. She stated she was very good with the kids and they all love
her. She denied ever seeing Staff 1 hit or be inappropriate with
the youth. She stated Staff 1 was seen as “Grandma”. She
stated no youth ever complain about Staff 1.
On 02/12/2025 an interview of Staff 4 at Wolverine occurred. She
denied any knowledge of Staff 1 being rough with youth at
Wolverine.
On 02/28/2025 a DHHS Specialist Case meeting was held.
DHHS advised of no findings relative to their investigation.
Allegation #2:
On 01/31/2025 an in-person interview of Youth A was completed
by DHHS Specialist 3 at Eagle Village. I participated via
telephone. Youth A reported that Staff 6 punched him in the left
side of his chest with a closed fist. He denied having any injuries,
but recalled it was sore. He stated that he told staff, but no one
believed him. He did not recall which staff he told this to and did
not remember when it occurred.
On 02/03/2025 an interview of Staff 1 was completed at
Wolverine. She denied knowledge of Staff 6 hitting Youth A. She
admitted that Youth A did talk a lot and instigate lots of situations,
but denied ever seeing staff hit him.
On 02/03/20205 an interview was completed with Youth C at
Wolverine. He denied ever seeing Staff 6 hit Youth A or any other
youth at Wolverine.
On 02/03/2025 an interview was completed with Youth D at
Wolverine. He denied ever seeing Staff 6 hit Youth A or any other
youth. He described Staff 6 as “an alright staff”.
On 02/12/2025 an interview was completed with Chief
Administrator (CA) at Wolverine. DHHS Specialist 3 was also
present. CA confirmed that there were no incident reports
involving Staff 6. She also confirmed that there is no disciplinary
actions in the file Staff 6.
4

On 02/12/2025 an interview was completed with Staff 2 and Staff
3 at Wolverine. They both denied knowledge of Staff 6 physically
assaulting Youth A or any other youth at the agency.
On 02/12/2025 an interview of Staff 4 at Wolverine occurred. She
recalled an incident occurring between Youth A and Youth B but
could not remember the exact date of the incident. She reported
Youth B went to take a shower and discovered feces in the
shower. He suspected that Youth A had caused it, which made
him upset. Youth B then tried to go to the room of Youth A, but
staff intervened by stopping him before any confrontation could
occur. Staff 4 reiterated that staff intervened and did not allow any
physical altercation to happen. She stated staff always intervenes
whenever there are altercations between youth, typically by
separating them to prevent any physical confrontation.
Video Review
Video dated 12/22/2024 was reviewed and it showed Staff 1
walking up and pushing or hitting Youth A in the head in an effort
to move him out of her way.
Documents Reviewed:
WHHS Behavior Management Policy:
All staff are to be certified in Crisis Prevention Institute Non-
Violent Crisis Intervention. Non-violent physical restrictions are
only to be used to protect clients or others from unanticipated or
severely aggressive behavior that places them at risk of violence
or injury if no intervention occurs. Interventions must be guided by
a number of factors, including safety of other clients and staff, size
and strength of client, degree of past violent behavior, whether the
client has a weapon, physical or health conditions of the client,
client's Individual Crisis Management Plan. Post-incident
debriefing must also occur.
DHHS Social Work Contacts:
Contact dated for 2/27/2025 and documented that a telephone
interview was completed with Staff 5 by DHHS Specialist 2. Staff
5 confirmed that he was the therapist for Youth A. He denied
Youth A ever disclosing any incidents between him and Staff 1 or
Staff 6. He also denied any of the other youth reporting any
concerns regarding Staff 1 or Staff 6.
Contact dated for 2/28/2025 and documented that a telephone
interview was completed with Staff 11 via telephone by DHHS
Specialist 2. He denied seeing any interactions with Youth A,
Staff 1 or Staff 6. He stated that Staff 6 does not work much, and
5

neither does he because they are both in college. He described
Staff 1 as “nice” and like a “grandma”.
Contact dated for 02/28/2025 and documented that DHHS
Specialist 2 completed a telephone interview with Staff 6. He
denied that the allegations are true. He stated he never had any
interactions with Youth A and did not remember who Youth A was.
He stated he never touches the children. He stated whenever a
youth acts out, he notified supervisors. He stated he has never
pushed, slapped, hit, or physically attacked any youth at the
agency. He stated the allegations are false and stated he attends
school and barely works at the facility. He did not have any
concerns regarding staff at the facility.
Tour of Agency:
A tour of the agency and specifically the area of the concerning
behavior was reviewed by myself and DHSS Specialist 3. No
areas of concern were noted. Youth were playing basketball in
the gym and staff were providing appropriate monitoring.
Analysis Allegation #1:
At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Both staff and youth
were interviewed, and video footage was reviewed that
documented the staff hit/pushed the youth, thus there was
sufficient evidence to support non-compliance.
Allegation #2:
At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Both staff and youth were
interviewed and there was not sufficient evidence to support
allegations of inappropriate actions by staff.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024C0001082SI CAP Approved 04/05/2024
2024C0001139SI CAP Approved 04/09/2024
2023C0000535SI CAP Approved 07/25/2023
2023C0000590SI CAP Approved 09/22/2023
2025SIC0000178 CAP Approved 02/25/2025
2025SIC0000236 CAP Approved 02/25/2025
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
6

supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff failed to intervene when youth was attacked by another
youth.
Investigation Interviews
On 01/31/2025 an in-person interview of Youth A was completed
by DHHS Specialist 3 at Eagle Village. I participated via
telephone. Youth A reported things have been going well for him
at Eagle Village. He reported that while placed at Wolverine,
Youth B punched him in the face, his nose was bleeding and staff
did not do anything. He stated “they did not tell him to stop. They
did not restrain him”. He did not have a specific time when it
occurred, but stated it was after Christmas and before he came to
Eagle Village. He stated that he believed Staff 2 and Staff 3 saw it
when he was punched in the face. Youth A stated it happened
more than once and staff never did anything.
The following interviews occurred at Wolverine on 02/03/2025
with myself and DHHS Specialist 1, unless otherwise noted.
An interview was completed with the Chief Administrator. She
was advised of the additional allegations involving Youth A and his
report that staff failed to intervene when he was punched in the
nose by another youth. She declined having any knowledge of
the alleged actions.
An interview was held with Staff 1. She recalled that Youth A had
a nosebleed but could not recall when or who caused it. She
denied Youth A ever reported to her that other youth were hitting
him or picking on him and staff failed to intervene. Staff 1
confirmed that staff always intervene when youth are not following
agency policy, and specifically if they are hitting other youth. Staff
1 also reported that Youth A was mostly with her. She confirmed
that other youth would sometimes try to pick on him, but she
always intervened and redirected the youth.
An interview was completed with Youth C. He recalled seeing
Youth B punch Youth A, but not necessarily in the nose. He
stated that staff would always intervene and try to get both youth
calmed down. He reported that a lot of the youth did not like
Youth A because he would spit and smear feces everywhere.
7

An interview was completed with Youth D. He reported he
recalled Youth B and Youth A getting into it. Youth B hit Youth A
in the face because Youth A spit on Youth D and called him a
“nigger”. He recalled that Youth A was bleeding and thinks he
saw a nurse. He further recalled that staff intervened. He stated
that staff always intervene and try to redirect behavior of youth.
On 02/12/2025 an interview was completed with Staff 2 at
Wolverine. He denied knowledge of staff refusing to intervene
when there is an issue or altercation with youth at the agency. He
reported staff always try to calm the youth down and will use a
protective stance and attempt to redirect the behavior.
On 02/12/2025 an interview was completed with Chief
Administrator (CA) at Wolverine. DHHS Specialist 3 was also
present. CA advised that there was no video footage of alleged
incident.
On 02/12/2025 an interview was held with Staff 3 at Wolverine.
She reported that staff always intervene if there is an issue
between youth at the agency. She further denied reports of
concern regarding this issue from youth at the agency.
On 03/13/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
B at his relative placement. Youth B was asked about the
incidents with him and Youth A. He reported that he does not
remember what occurred at Wolverine. He stated that Youth A
was always fighting and threatening people. He stated he did
remember making Youth A have a nosebleed, but he did not
remember any details. He confirmed that staff would intervene if
youth were fighting.
On 03/13/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 7
along with DHHS Specialist 2. She stated she does not
remember any incidents involving Youth A and Youth B. She did
indicate that Youth B would randomly hit youth, and when this
happened, staff would intervene by separating the youth and use
de-escalation techniques. Staff 7 denied that staff allowed youth
to fight with each other. She stated that she did not have much
interaction with Youth A. She was advised she was mentioned in
an incident report in December regarding an incident involving
Youth A and Youth B, however she indicated she did not recall the
specific incident and stated she hardly ever saw Youth A and
Youth B together.
8

On 03/13/2025 an interview was completed with Staff 8 along with
DHHS Specialist 3. She was advised of the allegations and that
her name was mentioned in an incident report involving Youth A
and Youth B. She stated she has been off work for a while and
did not recall any incidents involving Youth A and Youth B. She
mentioned that whenever there is an altercation between youth,
staff separate them, provides redirection and writes an incident
report. She also stated staff will examine the youth to determine if
medical attention is needed. Staff 8 again denied recalling any
incidents involving Youth A and Youth B even though she
authored the incident report on 1/05/2025.
On 03/13/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 9
along with DHHS Specialist 3. She was made aware of the
allegations and was informed that she was mentioned in incident
reported on 01/05/2025 regarding Youth A and Youth B. Staff 9
stated that in January 2025, staff escorted Youth A off the first
floor into the stairwell for a reason she could not remember. She
stated that Youth A was upset and crying. Youth B came to the
stairwell with other staff, but she could not remember who the
other staff members were. Youth B heard Youth A calling Staff 9
bad names, which caused Youth B to become upset. Staff
escorted Youth B outside, but somehow he was able to push pass
Staff 8 and hit Youth A in his nose. She reported that the nose of
Youth A began to bleed, and he was seen by a doctor.
On 03/13/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 10
along with DHHS Specialist 3. He was informed that his name
mentioned in an incident report involving Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 10 stated that he does not remember any incidents involving
Youth A and Youth B. He mentioned that he is considered a
strong staff member and often separates youth but does not recall
specific incidents with these two youth. He reported that staff
always intervenes by breaking up fights and separating youth. He
emphasized that youth are not allowed to fight.
Documents Reviewed:
Wolverine Incident Report Dated 01/05/2025 – Indicated at
11:40am Youth A was high speed on the first floor. He was
agitated and agitating all the youth. He was also verbally
aggressive and yelling he was going to “fuck the clients up”. Staff
was managing the environment by separating Youth A away from
the other youth. Youth A was kicking the office door and Youth B
walked past. Youth A swung toward Youth B. Youth B then
began punching Youth A while he was on the floor. Staff stepped
between them and then separated Youth A and Youth B. The
9

nose of Youth A was bleeding. The supervisor cleaned up the
blood. Youth A refused medical treatment and signed a form.
Staff involved was Staff 2, Staff 9 and Staff 6.
WHHS Behavior Management Policy:
All staff are to be certified in Crisis Prevention Institute Non-
Violent Crisis Intervention. Non-violent physical restrictions are
only to be used to protect clients or others from unanticipated or
severely aggressive behavior that places them at risk of violence
or injury if no intervention occurs. Interventions must be guided by
a number of factors, including safety of other clients and staff, size
and strength of client, degree of past violent behavior, whether the
client has a weapon, physical or health conditions of the client,
client's Individual Crisis Management Plan. Post-incident
debriefing must also occur.
DHHS Social Work Contacts:
Contact documented that a telephone interview was completed
with Staff 5 by DHHS Specialist. Staff 5 confirmed that he was
the therapist for Youth A. He denied knowledge of a fight between
Youth A and Youth B. He sees both youth and denied either had
mentioned anything to him regarding an incident. He lastly stated
that to his knowledge staff always intervenes during fights by
separating youth and redirecting negative behavior. He denied
that any resident has ever advised him that staff failed to intervene
during a fight.
Contact dated for 2/28/2025 and documented that a telephone
interview was completed with Staff 11 via telephone. He did not
recall any incident between Youth A and Youth B. But indicated
that staff intervenes when incidents occur and they will often
remove the aggressive youth from the scene. He stated staff
does not allow youth to fight. He denied ever seeing any staff at
the facility hurt, harm, or physically abuse any of the youth.
Contact dated for 02/28/2025 and documented that DHHS
specialist 2 completed a telephone interview with Staff 6. He
stated whenever a youth acts out, he notified supervisors. He
stated he has never pushed, slapped, hit, or physically attacked
any youth at the agency. He did not have any concerns regarding
staff at the facility. He did not recall any incidents between Youth
A and Youth B. He stated that Youth A was involved in disputes
with youth and staff always intervened by removing him off the
unit or out of the area with the youth until he was calm. He denied
staff allowing youth to fight.
10

Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. After interviews of both staff
and youth, there was no evidence to support non-compliance by
the agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Heath services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following: (a) Routine
and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral health care.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency failed to provide medical attention for youth after he was
hit by another youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 01/31/2025 an in-person interview of Youth A was completed
by DHHS Specialist 3 at Eagle Village. I participated via
telephone. He reported that while placed at Wolverine, Youth B
punched him in the face, his nose was bleeding and staff did not
do anything. He reported that he asked to go to nursing and staff
told him he was fine and didn't need to. He was not able to recall
which staff told him that.
The following interviews occurred at Wolverine on 02/03/2025
with myself and DHHS Specialist 1, unless otherwise noted.
An interview was completed with the Chief Administrator. She
was advised of the additional allegations involving Youth A and
other staff. She declined having any knowledge of the alleged
actions.
An interview was completed with Staff 1. She denied any
knowledge of Youth A being denied a need or request to go to the
hospital or to see the nurse.
An interview was completed with Youth C. He denied ever
knowing of Youth A or any youth needing medical attention and it
was not provided. He reported staff always gave Youth A medical
attention. He described Youth A as being over dramatic and
always trying to get attention.
11

An interview was completed with Youth D. He recalled a time
when Youth A had a nosebleed because he was not hit by a staff.
He reported that he believes Youth A saw a nurse but could not
say for sure.
Documents Reviewed:
Wolverine Incident Report Dated 01/05/2025 – Indicated at
11:40am Youth A was high speed on the first floor. He was
agitated and agitating all the youth. He was also verbally
aggressive and yelling he was going to “fuck the clients up”. Staff
was managed the environment by separating Youth A away from
the other youth. Youth A was kicking the office door and Youth B
walked past. Youth A swung toward Youth B. Youth B then
began punching Youth A while he was on the floor. Staff stepped
between them and then separated Youth A and Youth B. The
nose of Youth A was bleeding. The supervisor cleaned up the
blood. Youth A refused medical treatment and signed a form.
Staff involved was Staff 2, Staff 9 and Staff 6.
Wolverine Client Refusal Form – Form was completed and dated
for 1/5/2025 indicated that Youth A declined medical treatment
due to being punched in the nose.
DHHS Specialist 3 SW Contact – Staff 9 was informed that she
was mentioned in incident reports relative to Youth A and Youth B.
She reported that she recalled in December 2025 she was
escorting Youth A off the first floor but could not recall why. Youth
A was upset and crying. Youth B came into the stairwell with
other staff. Youth B overheard Youth A calling staff bad names
and Youth B became upset. Youth B was escorted outside as a
part of redirection but was able to push past staff in some way and
hit Youth A in the nose. Staff intervened and separated the youth.
She also recalled another incident in January when staff were
explaining the rules of a basketball game and Youth B got upset
because Youth A was being disrespectful toward staff and not
listening. Youth B threw the ball and hit Youth A in the face. Staff
9 reported that staff properly intervened and redirected the
negative behavior of Youth A. She did not recall further details or
whether Youth A received a medical exam. Staff 9 stated that
staff intervenes by separating youth whenever there are any
incidents. She stated staff does not allow youth to fight.
Analysis The agency was found to be in compliance with the licensing rule.
Both staff and youth were interviewed and there was not sufficient
evidence to support allegations that the youth was not offered
medical treatment.
12

Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required. .
04/08/2025
______________________________________________________________________
Cassandra Thomas Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
04/08/2025

13
